title: Explore Lima On Bike: Coast Cycling Adventure
description: If you’d like to bicycle around Lima but aren’t sure where to go, this private tour shows you the way. Starting in Miraflores, you’ll cycle through the bohemian district of Barranco and up to Morro Solar, finishing back in cosmopolitan Miraflores. It’s an excellent orientation to significant city landmarks, all explained by your guide.
all_descriptions: If you’d like to bicycle around Lima but aren’t sure where to go, this private tour shows you the way. Starting in Miraflores, you’ll cycle through the bohemian district of Barranco and up to Morro Solar, finishing back in cosmopolitan Miraflores. It’s an excellent orientation to significant city landmarks, all explained by your guide.

Climb aboard your modern bicycle and begin your experience, stopping at impressive war memorials and significant historical landmarks as your guide offers insight into Lima’s colorful past. First stop to revitalize will be the charming seaside neighborhood of Chorillos where it is possible to admire outstanding views of the Pacific Ocean before riding into the bohemian barrio of Barranco, an artistic enclave in which musicians, writers and artists reign supreme. 

Admire enthralling examples of street art, colorful murals and cross through the famous Bridge of Sighs before following the curve of the coast towards Miraflores; gaze at the silken sands and perfect waves for surf of the Pacific Ocean as you arrive at Parque del Amor. Absorb the amorous atmosphere and appreciate constructions reminiscent of the work of Spanish architect Antoni Gaudi; stroll past romantically inspired statures before bidding your group farewell in this lovely location.
Calle Alcanfores 465, Miraflores 15074, PeruCalle Alcanfores 465, Miraflores 15074, Peru (In front of Naia Coffee Shop)
Parroquia La Virgen Milagrosa, Ca. Lima 345, Miraflores 15074, PeruMain gate of the Church Virgen Milagrosa in Miraflores

Mei
1 contribution

Fantastic bike tour through Lima

Aug 2025 • Solo
I was quite nervous booking this tour as I don’t ride a bike regularly, but I needn’t have worried as I was well looked after. This tour is a great way to explore Lima through its network of bike lanes, and you cover many of the main sites and sounds across three neighbourhoods. I did the tour on a Sunday so there was not too much traffic and the path was mostly flat. Big thank you my guide Tito for your hospitality and wonderful welcome to Lima!
Written August 24, 2025

Beautiful bike tour along the Lima coast

Apr 2025 • Friends
Highly recommended tour
Super choice of route: beautiful views along the coast and exploring the colorful and artistic district of Baranco

Excellent guide: great explanations
Tito our guide gave us with his extensive knowledge of the geology, faces, architecture and culture of the city
I'm impressed.

The speed of the tour was well adapted to us and we were able to make sufficient breaks (for photo stops, closer visit of Baranco and for resting or explanations)
The bikes were in top condition we felt safe throughout. Tito always drove ahead and got us through traffic safely and well.

Liz
Brisbane, Australia141 contributions

Not a private cycling experience - misleading.

Sadly this was very disappointing, as much as I love to support local businesses. We booked and paid for a Private Coast Cycling Experience to start at 9am, instead we got 6 people on our tour leaving around 10am (no apology, no explanation, no refund).
We do private cycling tours all over the world: that way the guides can customise the ride according to our fitness and enjoyment level (always been successful). Today was not enjoyable and it was clear the guide just wanted to get this tour over and done with. Feel a bit ripped off, plus the fact that I felt embarrassed lagging behind (reason a nearly 60 year old lady booked a private tour and not to race with lovely 30-year olds - felt guilty keeping them up). If you want cheap group tours then yes it’s for you (nothing wrong with it, I was there too once). However if you want a private cycling tour look elsewhere.
Written November 2, 2022
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
jimleeyoung
Port of Spain, Trinidad3 contributions

Bike rid in Lima

Nov 2019 • Business
A great trip and fantastic way to see a lot of Lima. Tito and Rudolfo were great guides. Had a lot of fun and would recommend thoroughly. Not strenuous at all. Only concern was the short ride through the unlit two lane tunnel without lights on the bike. Scary stuff with vehicles thundering past. Easily solved by outfitting low cost high intensity lights on the bike
Written November 14, 2019

Great bile tour of Lima

A fun way to see some of Lima that I likely wouldn’t have otherwise. Tito was a great guide and kept us safe. One piece of advice - wear sunscreen, even if it’s overcast!

Palmerston North, New Zealand44 contributions

Great way to spend 1/2 day

Jul 2019 • Family
Thanks for a great morning!! Guide Raoul (Rod), and our driver, were friendly and made sure we were looked after. Most of the bike trip is down hill - some up hill but worth it. Guide had lots of information, and passion, for his home town. Great way to start our Peruvian adventure. Would definitely recommend if confident on a bike and enjoy an adventure.
Written July 6, 2019
This review is the subjective opinion of a Tripadvisor member and not of Tripadvisor LLC. Tripadvisor performs checks on reviews as part of our industry-leading trust & safety standards. Read our transparency report to learn more.
